newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Karachi bourse reverts to Islamic weekend.
newsitem.headline: Karachi bourse reverts to Islamic weekend.

text.p: Pakistan's main Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) said on Wednesday it had decided to revert to the Friday-Saturday weekend, only a week after deciding to observe Sunday as weekly holiday instead of Friday.
The KSE said it had reversed last week's decision because of problems it faced on Friday while government offices and banks remained closed on the day.
"Considering problems due to closure of banks, financial insitutions and government offices on Friday, the KSE operations (on Friday) cannot be practical and meaningful," it said.

KSE had announced on October 2 that it would open on Friday and observe Saturday-Sunday as weekly holidays, following a decision by Pakistan's top busisness organisation to revert to Sunday as weekly holiday instead of Friday.
Businessmen and traders say holiday on Friday effectively cuts them off from markets in Europe and the U.S. where Saturday and Sunday are observed as weekly holidays.
But religious parties have strongly opposed the idea as Friday is considered to be a holy day for Moslems.
